overview: A Job Grant is a one-off payment when you stop benefits and start work. Find out about what you'll get, eligibility and how to claim.
title: Job Grant

table.body:
Job Grant is a payment you may get when you stop claiming benefits because you're starting work.

You can get £100 or £250, depending on whether you have children.

You must tell Jobcentre Plus you've started full time work within 21 days of doing so to get a Job Grant.
table.title: Overview

table.body:
The amount of Job Grant you get will depend on your circumstances.

You can get one of the following amounts:

- £100 for single people and couples without children 
- £250 for lone parents and couples with children

##How Job Grant is paid##

You will be paid in the same way as you were paid benefits.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
You must be going straight from claiming benefits to starting work. Your work must be:

- at least 16 hours a week (this can be a combination of jobs)
- expected to last for at least 5 weeks

You could get Job Grant if your benefits have stopped because your partner is now working at least 24 hours a week and their work is expected to last for at least 5 weeks.

% You must tell Jobcentre Plus you have moved into full time work within 21 days of doing so to get a Job Grant %

##Benefits you must have claimed##

You must have been claiming 1 or more of the following benefits continuously for at least 26 weeks immediately before starting work:

- Jobseeker's Allowance
- Income Support
- Employment and Support Allowance
- Incapacity Benefit
- Severe Disablement Allowance
- Jobcentre Plus/New Deal Allowance payments (where the allowance is based on Jobseeker's Allowance, Income Support, Employment Support Allowance, Incapacity Benefit or Severe Disablement Allowance)
- Employment Zone payments (where the allowance is based on Jobseeker's Allowance)

% You can only get Job Grant if you've been getting benefits - if you're signing on or providing medical evidence to get National Insurance contributions only, you're not eligible %
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
If you qualify for a Job Grant it will be paid to you automatically when your benefit claim is closed.

You must tell [Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} you have started full time work within 21 days of doing so.
table.title: How to claim

table.body:
##Effect on other benefits##

Job Grant is a tax-free payment.

It doesn't reduce other benefits or tax credits you may get when you start work.

You may also qualify for [Extended Council Tax Benefit](/council-tax-benefit?edition=2&cache=1326723248 "Extended Council Tax Benefit") and [Extended Housing Benefit.](/housing-benefit?edition=1&cache=1326723333 "Extended Housing Benefit")

##Disputes and appeals##

If you're refused a Job Grant payment you can ask for the decision to be reconsidered by [Jobcentre Plus.](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "contacting Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"}
